intro: Buchenavia callistachya, commonly known as the Mexican redwood, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its thick, reddish bark and smooth, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in warm climates.
